fee_codes.description: Consultation*
Special genetic consultation*
fee_codes.conditions: Medical record requirements: The service is eligible for payment only if start and stop times of the service are recorded in the patient's permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Extended special genetic consultation*
fee_codes.conditions: Medical record requirements: The service is eligible for payment only if start and stop times of the service are recorded in the patient's permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Limited consultation
Repeat consultation
Genetic minor assessment
Genetic assessment, patient or family
fee_codes.conditions: Payment rules: This service is limited to 4 units per patient per day.

fee_codes.description: Midwife or Aboriginal Midwife-requested genetic assessment
fee_codes.conditions: Payment rules: This service is limited to one per patient, per physician, per 12 month period.

fee_codes.description: Comprehensive midwife or aboriginal midwife-requested genetic assessment
fee_codes.conditions: Medical record requirements: The service is eligible for payment only if start and stop times of the service are recorded in the patient's permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Extended midwife or aboriginal midwife-requested genetic assessment
fee_codes.conditions: Medical record requirements: The service is eligible for payment only if start and stop times of the service are recorded in the patient's permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Genetic care, patient or family
fee_codes.conditions: Payment rules: This service is limited to 4 units per patient per day.

fee_codes.description: Clinical interpretation
fee_codes.conditions: Payment rules: This service is not eligible for payment when rendered in association with a consultation on the same patient.

fee_codes.description: Clinical interpretation requested by a midwife or aboriginal midwife
Complex genetic test interpretation
fee_codes.conditions: Payment rules: 1. Complex genetic test interpretation includes interpretation done for any genetic testing where the laboratory report does not clearly explain the patient’s phenotype or requires additional review to understand the implications of the result. 2. Unit means ½ hour or major part thereof - see General Preamble GP7, GP54 and GP55 for definitions and time-keeping requirements. 3. Time units are calculated based on the duration of time spent exclusively interpreting the complex genetic tests. 4. Maximum of 2 units per patient, per physician, per 12 month period.

fee_codes.description: Genetic family counselling
fee_codes.conditions: Note: Unit means ½ hour or major part thereof - see General Preamble GP7, GP55 for definitions and time keeping requirements.

fee_codes.description: Consultation*
Special genetic consultation* - subject to the same conditions as A220
Extended special genetic consultation* - subject to the same conditions as A223
Limited consultation
Repeat consultation
Midwife or Aboriginal Midwife-requested genetic assessment – subject to the same conditions as A800
Comprehensive midwife or aboriginal midwife-requested genetic assessment – subject to the same conditions as A801
Extended midwife or aboriginal midwife-requested genetic assessment – subject to the same conditions as A802
Subsequent visits - first five weeks
Subsequent visits - sixth to thirteenth week inclusive (maximum 3 per patient per week)
Subsequent visits - after thirteenth week (maximum 6 per patient per month)
Consultation*
Special genetic consultation* - subject to the same conditions as A220
Extended special genetic consultation* - subject to the same conditions as A223
Limited consultation
Repeat consultation
Subsequent visits - first 4 subsequent visits per patient per month
Subsequent visits - additional subsequent visits (maximum of 6 per patient per month)
Subsequent visits - palliative care (see General Preamble GP50)
Subsequent visits - first 2 subsequent visits per patient per month
Subsequent visits - subsequent visits per month (maximum of 3 per patient per month)
Subsequent visits - palliative care (see General Preamble GP50)
Additional visits due to intercurrent illness (see General Preamble GP49)
